citation.article-title: Gordonia araii sp. nov. and Gordonia effusa sp. nov., isolated from patients in Japan
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Gordonia araii sp. nov.
Gordonia araii (a.rai′i. N.L. gen. n. araii of Arai, to honour Tadashi Arai, a Japanese microbiologist, for his valuable contributions to microbial taxonomy and secondary metabolites).
Aerobic, Gram-positive, slightly acid-fast, non-motile rods (0.3–0.5×0.5–1.1 μm).
Colonies are rough with irregular margins.
Colonies are 1.5–3.5 mm in diameter after 7 days at 30 °C on MH II medium.
Utilizes glucose, but not adonitol, arabinose, erythritol, galactose, myo-inositol, maltose, mannose or sorbitol.
Adenine, hypoxanthine, tyrosine, urea and xanthine are not hydrolysed.
Contains meso-DAP, arabinose and galactose (cell wall chemotype IV sensu Lechevalier & Lechevalier, 1980).
Major fatty acids are C14 : 0, C16 : 1cis-9, C16 : 0, C18 : 1cis-9, C18 : 0 and 10-methyl C18 : 0.
Mycolic acids are present with a range of total carbon number from 64 to 70.
The type strain, IFM 10211T (=DSM 44811T=NBRC 100433T=JCM 12131T), was isolated from a clinical specimen.
